fields.headline: Critics' choice
fields.bodyText: The book Home Now by Lesley Beake, illustrated by Karin Littlewood Frances Lincoln. Price £11.99. Age 5-8 yrs Once, Sieta lived with her Ma and Pa in a house where tins of brightly coloured geraniums grew in the sunshine beside their door. But her parents got sick and died, and so Sieta's aunt brought her to Home Now, where she lies in bed under a plastic roof, remembering the past. The sprawling South African township doesn't feel like home at all to the little girl. Then Sieta encounters an orphaned elephant, brought from Kruger National Park so that he, too, can be looked after and, in empathising with him, she finds solace and friendship for herself. She learns to take comfort from the everyday routines of a life among friends, and a final poignant moment of acceptance comes when her aunt plants tubs of vibrant flowers outside her new front door. An afterword gives information about the plight of Aids orphans in Africa, and teachers can choose whether to talk about this as they read, or to let the story's universal messages about loss, grief and new hope stand alone. The web Numeracy: time www.enjoymaths.co.uk Suitable for: KS1/2 teachers This is a subscription website but a worksheet on time is available as a free sample. Scroll down the list of subjects to year 5 and select "vocabulary related to time". A worksheet on train timetables enables pupils to extract information from a table and calculate the time taken for railway journeys. http://mambo.ucsc.edu/cgi-bin/kidklok.cgi? Suitable for: KS1/2 teachers This is one of several sites that provide a large display clock to demonstrate time. www.lunchclock.com/ Suitable for: KS1/2 teachers This is great fun, although its use in school may not go down too well with the dinner ladies. It's a digital clock to run on your computer. It runs a little faster than it should in the morning and afternoon and a little slower at midday, giving you a longer lunch time! www.mathfactcafe.com/time/ Suitable for: KS1/2 teachers This is a great time-saving website as it allows teachers to construct worksheets. www.mrmyers.org/Math_Mania/math.html Suitable for: KS1/2 teachers & pupils Scroll down to Telling Time and select Jude e-clock. Children can see the effect of choosing to move the time forward or back by 1, 5, 10, 15, 30 or 60 minutes. www.teachingideas.co.uk Suitable for: KS1 & 2 teachers In the maths section, under measurement, there are plenty of useful resources submitted by teachers such as worksheets to convert different times.
